gurmukhi: CIr swgr hY jhwN sun rwj rwj vqwr ]m`C audr miCMdR jogI bYT hY biRqDwr ]
transliteration: Chheer Saagad Hai Jahaan Soun Raaj Raaj Vataar|| Machchh Udar Machhindra Jogibaith Hai Britdhaar||
translation: “O king ! the Yogi Matsyendra is sitting in contemplation in the belly of the fish in milk-ocean;

gurmukhi: fwr jwr inkwr qwkh pUC lyh bnwie ]jo khw so kIjIAY niRp iehI s`q aupwie ]137]
transliteration: Daar Jaar Nikaar Taakah Poochh Leh Banaae|| Jo Kahaa So Keejeeai Nrip Ehisatt Oupaae||137||
translation: “Take him out with your net and ask him, O king ! do whatever I have said; this is the real measure?”137.

gurmukhi: joir bIrn lwK isMDh Awg cwl subwh ]hUr pUr rhI jhw qh j`qR q`qR auCwh ]
transliteration: Jor(i) Bderan Laakh Sindhah Aag Dhaal Soubaah|| Hoor Poor Rahijahaa Tah Jattra Tattra Ouchhaad||
translation: The king gathering together lakhs of his warriors moved away further from the ocean; where the heavenly damsels were moving here and there enthusiastically;

gurmukhi: BwNq BwNq bjMqR bwjq Aaur Gurq inSwn ]CIr isMD huqo jhw iqh Twm phuMcy Awn ]138]
transliteration: Bhaant Bhaant Bajantra Baajat Aur Dhurat Nishaan|| Chheer Sindh Houto Jahaa Tih Thaam Pahounche Aan||138||
translation: They all reached there sounding their drums and playing instruments of various types, where there was the milk-ocean.138.

gurmukhi: sUqR jwr bnwie kY iqh m`iD fwr Apwr ]Aaur jIv Gny ghy n ivlokXo iSv bwr ]
transliteration: Sootra Jaar Banaae Kai Tih Maddh(i) Daar Apaar|| Aur Jeev Ghane Gade Na Vilokayo Shiv Baar||
translation: The nets of cotton were prepared and thrown into the ocean, in which many other beings were caught, but the son of Shiva (Matsyendra) was not seen;

gurmukhi: hwir hwir iPrY sBY Bt Awn BUpq qIr ]Aaur jIv Gny ghy pr so n pwv PkIr ]139]
transliteration: Daar(i) Daar(i) Phirai Sabhai Bhat Aan Bhoopat Teer|| Aur Jeev Ghane Gade Par So Na Paav Fakeer||139||
translation: All the warriors, greatly tired came before the king and said, “Many other beings have been caught, but that sage is nowhere to be found.”139.

gurmukhi: m`C pyt miCMdR jogI bYT hY ibn Aws ]jwr Byt skY n vwko mon AMg subws ]
transliteration: Machchh Pet Machhindra Jogibaith Hai Bin Aas|| Jaar Bhet Sakai Na Vaako Mon An Soubaas||
translation: The Yogi is sitting desireless in the belly of the fish and this can’t entrap him;

gurmukhi: eyk jwr sunw nXo iqh fwrIAY Aibcwr ]s`q bwq khY qumY suin rwj rwj vqwr ]140]
transliteration: Ek Jaar Sounaa Nayo Tih Dareeai Abichaar|| Satt Baat Kahai Toumai Soun(i) Raaj Raaj Vataar||140||
translation: “Now, O king ! throw another net immediately and this is the only step to catch him.”140.

gurmukhi: igAwn nwm sunw hmo iqh jwir ko niRp rwie ]qaun qw mY fwr kY mun rwj lyhu ghwie ]
transliteration: Giaan Naam Sounaa Hamo Tih Daar(i) Ko Nrip Raae|| Taoun Taa Mai Daar Kai Mounndraaj Leh(u) Gadaae||
translation: “O king ! we have heard about the name of the net of knowledge, throw the same in the ocean and catch the great sage;

gurmukhi: XO n hwiQ pry munISr bIq hY bhu brK ]s`q bwq kho qumY suin lIjIAY BrqrK ]141]
transliteration: Yau Na Haath(i) Dare Mounndeshar Beet Hai Bahu Barakh|| Satt Baat Kaho Toumai Soun(i) Leejeeai Bhartarakh||141||
translation: “The sage will not be caught with any other measure even for years; O protector ! listen to it, we are telling you the truth.”141.
